snippet: If Mr. Trump continues, once inaugurated, to profit from transactions with companies controlled by foreign governments, he may run afoul of the Emoluments Clause....
abstract: Emoluments Clause of Constitution poses risks for Pres-elect Donald Trump should he persist in attempting to gain benefits from companies controlled by foreign governments; experts in legal ethics say number of arrangements between Trump's companies and foreign state-backed entities could easily run afoul of clause.
lead_paragraph: If Mr. Trump continues, once inaugurated, to profit from transactions with companies controlled by foreign governments, he may run afoul of the Emoluments Clause.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Business Dealings Test a Constitutional Limit
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Foreign Business Deals  May Test a Constitutional Limit
